description: Erection of a single storey rear/ side extension with sukkah roof and formation of an internal lightwell, erection of a rear dormer with the insertion of x2 front rooflights
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance including type, size, colour, bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture.&nbsp;</p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-8341e06b-7fff-31f3-f6b5-c23f1f37721e"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</span></span></p>

<p>The roof lights on the front roof slope must be conservation style and must be retained for the duration of the development.</p><p>REASON: To preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the conservation area.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until at least one swift brick or nesting box suitable for sparrows or starlings has been installed at the property in accordance with the manufacturer's specification.The biodiversity enhancement installed shall be thereafter retained.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of promoting biodiversity at the site.</p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways, i.e., plastic modules and soakaway rings, are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume. The development shall be implemented as per the approved details.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: In the interest of sustainable urban drainage.</p>
